alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A RAPIDLY DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN LEWIS COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 146 PM EDT, a rapidly developing thunderstorm was located over Head of Grassy, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Head of Grassy, Harris and Emerson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northeastern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
